abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Renewable Resources
            Development Project: Tamil Nadu Newsprint and Papers Limited
            Papermill Expansion Component for India was highly
            satisfactory. The project achieved all of its major
            objectives, institutional development has been partially
            achieved, sustainability is likely, and the performance of
            the Bank was satisfactory while the Borrower's was
            highly satisfactory. Several lessons can be learned from
            this project. First, a well-prepared project by an
            experienced client will succeed if it contains all the basic
            ingredients for a successful industrial project. Second, the
            use of innovative and pioneering technology in developing
            countries is a suitable basis for Bank financed projects
            provided that the technology has been thoroughly researched.
            Third, early agreement on model tender documents, in this
            case by pre-appraisal stage, significantly facilitated
            procurement processing, timely equipment delivery, and
            disbursements. Fourth, the effort, commitment, and goodwill
            invested by TNPL in preparing a resettlement and
            rehabilitation action plan for the PAFs resulted in its
            smooth and speedy implementation. Finally, to ensure their
            long-term sustainability, technology innovations and
            investments in state-of-the-art industrial machinery and
            equipment should be accompanied by state-of-the-art
            environmental and safety management systems.
